climbs.name: Arrowhead North Face
climbs.fa: FRA: James Garrett and Allan Murphy, May 1985

content.description: We climbed the longest part of the wall to the tip of the arrowhead. The rock quality is typical for Mount Olympus. Long hike or ski approach for a few pitches would be the only disadvantage, but we skied incredible corn back down to Neffs Canyon. I have asked many other climbers since our ascent if they had any knowledge of anyone else climbing this route. I heard of no one, but I would love to hear of other people's accounts?
content.protection: Pitons, Alpine gear, Set of Nuts
content.location: Our descent was quick, easy, and fun skiing back to the car parked at the trailhead for Neffs Canyon
